chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lupe Medina III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
**  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given -  $250.
  May Not have contact with minors without permission of agent or Jennifer M and Raymond H or Ariana M..  Follow recommendations of Sex Offender Treatment assessment, drug and alcohol assessment and Mental Health Evaluation.  Create a realistic case plan  Re: Goals and Needs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 5 years consecutive to any other sentence.  Def. to comply with mandatory sex offender registry and reporting.
by agent Barbara Hess

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
received from Atty Lassiter

Court received email correspondence that Atty Lassiter is out ill today. DE is sent back to the jail and Per Atty DeFilippis she is requesting a date later this week for a plea.  Plea Hearing on 10/14/15 at 11:00 AM.

NO RECORD TAKEN:    Attorney Margie Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter appeared.  Clerk: PT
